column4: WoW ran just fine under wine for me (I was using 8.10 though)
How does it run compared to running on windows??
there's no hardware acceleration for the mouse in OpenGL mode... but that's about the only downside
how does that affect it? im not entirely sure what hardware accel does for the mouse
your mouse won't feel as smooth as it should.. if it really is a problem, some people have created a whine patch that makes it use your desktop icon instead
So you think it should be fine???
wine* patch.. you'll have to manually build wine to apply it though
depends really, you should try it out and make the consideration for yourself... dont forget to run with -opengl parameter
I just found something about opengl in this guide. I think it says something like that. THanks a lot
we just have to hope blizzard will add hardware acceleration for OpenGL in windows (it does have it on the Mac!)
Mac is a *nix like OS, right? can you run mac binaries on linux??
Mac is based on a BSD kernel which is indeed based off of unix, but as usser has stated, binaries are indeed incompatible unfortunately
usser, :( disapointment. If there was a program like wine for Mac binaries in Linux, would it work better than wine?
Not really, the problem is that blizzard was too lazy to add hardware acceleration for cursors in openGL mode in their windows binaries
that would seem logical for their development point of view (windows users should generally be using direct3d), but wine uses an opengl wrapper to handle direct3d code
